publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7807 Marilyn Livingstone: West Wemyss Monument to Local Heroes—That the Parliament notes the 70th anniversary of the deaths of four men and a teenage boy who died while attempting to save West Wemyss from a drifting sea mine; understands that, on 23 January 1941, the mine, packed with 320lbs of high explosives, broke free of the moorings that it was anchored to as a defence against U-boats and other enemy shipping; notes that it was drifting toward the village seafront and nearby gas storage tanks; commends the fact that, together, they set off to Lady’s Rock to try to protect the village, and, in case the mine drifted back out to sea, shipping that used the nearby harbours of Methil and Kirkcaldy; understands that two of the men and the teenage boy died instantly when it detonated, and commends the fact that, after a £10,000 fundraising campaign, a monument has been unveiled to mark their heroism and that 350 people attended the ceremony and a service in their memory to commemorate their bravery seven decades later.
